lead_paragraph: Meghan Duggan broke a tie on a power play midway through the third period and the United States beat Canada, 4-2, to set up a title-game rematch with the Canadians in Harbin, China, for the women’s world championship. Natalie Darwitz had two goals and an assist and Caitlin Cahow added a goal to help the United States rebound from a 1-0 overtime loss to Finland.
